intro: Humboltia gardneri, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has woody stems and produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are usually pink or red in color. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Humboltia gardneri is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water requirements.
